intro: Linanthus nudatus, commonly known as the naked linanthus, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the evening primrose family (Onagraceae) and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils in arid or semi-arid environments. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Linanthus nudatus is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas.
